offload.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to get rid of something that you do not want by giving it or selling it to someone else
offload.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The dealer had offloaded some of the shares onto a willing client.
offload.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to take something off a truck or ship
offload.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to get rid of something you do not want by giving or selling it to someone
offload.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Most high street chains managed to offload last season’s stock by offering discounts of up to 50%.
A dealer offloaded 5,000 of the shares onto a client.
offload.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to take goods off a truck or ship
offload.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Dockers were offloading the ship’s cargo.
